intro: Polygala areguensis, commonly known as the Arequipa milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Peru. It belongs to the genus Polygala, which includes over 700 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, usually yellow or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
